719047f.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Grand Street
719047f.text:
Columbia Street, east side, north from but not including Grand Stre-t.
Anril 1, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719047f.folder: Columbia Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

719045f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Grand Street
719045f-a.text:
(1)
Columbia Street, west side, north from but not including Grand Street,
to and including Broome Street.
April 4, 1928.
P. L Sperr.
NO RAPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A more extensive view northward. Note the Williamsburg Bridge at
Delancey Street. The buildings shown in the foreground have been demolished
and replaced by a modern apartment house.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.
719045f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

719044f-a.title: Manhattan: Columbia Street - Grand Street
719044f-a.text:
Columbia Street, west side, north from but not including Grand,
to but not including Broome Streets. Also shown (right) is Broome
Street, north side, west from but not including Columbia, to but not
including Willett Streets. Acroas the construction appears Sheriff
Street, west side, north from but not including Grand, to and including
Broome Streets. Building being erected on the former site of the R.
Hoe and Company Printing Machine Manufacturers, will be a model slum
clearance apartment house, sponsered by Governor Lehman.
June 1, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719044f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720128f-b.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Columbia Street
720128f-b.text:
(1)
522-534 Grand Street, at, adjoining, and east of the N.E. corner
of Columbia Street. Nos. 522-530 are all frame houses with brick
fronts.
1932.
J. Clarence Davies Collection, Museum of the City of New York.
Negative No. 299.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing a closer view of frame houses.
July 22, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

720128f-a.folder: Grand Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

720134f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Columbia Street
720134f-a.text:
Grand Street, north sido, east from Columbia Street to East River.
Note the 4 hip-roofed houses (Nos. 324-530) that are just east of the 4-story
building (No. 522) at the corner. These buildings are of frame construction
with brick fronts. Pictures,slightly later,show No. 524 improved.
April 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
TAY DE REPRODUCED.
720134f-a.folder: Grand Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY
